title: Can diamonds be detected by a metal detector? - Quora

response.answer_text: This leads to an important point: metal detectors will not detect non metal items such as gemstones, diamonds and pearls. What a metal detector can do is lead you to indicator minerals, which are used by prospectors. Prospectors follow the indicator trail back to gold or the volcanic pipe which may contain diamonds.

No. Not unless they are set in metal fittings. A diamond is mineral, it is carbon. In fact, in a fire, diamonds will actually catch fire and burn! A metal detector works by detecting aberrations in the electromagnetic field, generated by the search coil. a diamond, unset, will not disturb that field any more than a common rock would.

This leads to an important point: metal detector will not detect non metal items such as gemstones, diamonds and pearls. What a metal detector can do is lead you to indicator minerals, which are used by prospectors. Prospectors follow the indicator trail back to gold or the volcanic pipe which may contain diamonds.
